results.title: Wisconsin: Girls in ‘Slender Man’ Case Ordered to Remain in Adult Court
results.abstract: A judge ruled that two 13-year-olds accused of stabbing a classmate last year to please an online horror character will stay in adult court.

results.title: Stock Buybacks Draw Scrutiny From Politicians
results.abstract: Hillary Clinton and others are asking whether there’s a need for greater regulation of stock buybacks, on which companies have spent $7 trillion since 2004.

results.title: Alphabet Wordplay, a Hooli ‘Easter Egg’ and More On Google’s Name Change
results.abstract: With wordplay and references to the Google parody from the HBO series “Silicon Valley,” the company formerly known as Google Inc. captured the imagination and curiosity of the Internet with its reorganization on Monday.

results.title: Loss of $586 Million Shows Improvement for Postal Service
results.abstract: The Postal Service reported a net loss of $586 million in the quarter that ended in June, an improvement over a $2 billion loss at the same time last year.

results.title: Virginia: Liquor Agents Are Cleared in Arrest That Sparked an Uproar
results.abstract: A state agency said three liquor agents involved in a bloody arrest that prompted allegations of racism followed procedures and did nothing wrong.
org_facet: Virginia Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control

results.title: Oklahoma: Judge Calls Curbs on Abortion Drugs Unconstitutional
results.abstract: A judge struck down a state law requiring doctors to follow label instructions when prescribing abortion-inducing drugs.

results.title: A French Couple’s Love for the American West Ends in Tragedy
results.abstract: David and Ornella Steiner were found dead in a New Mexico desert last week. Their 9-year-old son survived, likely because they sacrificed water to save him.

results.title: Lawrence Lessig to Explore a Run for President as a Democrat
results.abstract: Mr. Lessig, the Harvard professor and democratic theorist, said he would explore a protest bid for the Democratic nomination if he can raise $1 million in small donations by Labor Day, and would tie his campaign to the issue of empowering small donors in politics.

results.title: Marin Cilic Struggles to Get Back Into Zone After U.S. Open Success
results.abstract: As the No. 14 seed last year, Cilic claimed his first Grand Slam title. But since then, he has been bothered by a shoulder injury and has yet to reach the final of any tournament.
